title: ferdosa on Twitter
excerpt: “Kudos to @brielarson for giving Joanna Bennett and Renae Moneymaker this moment to shine. Stunt work is incredibly difficult and it takes a lot of talent to do what these women do in #CaptainMarvel. It's a craft that deserves more respect. https://t.co/fvmIE0YRGI”
description: Brie Larson decided to let her stunt doubles take the spotlight with her for the work done in Captain Marvel.

summary: Il Marvel Cinematic Universe continua a segnare la storia del cinema
title: Il Marvel Cinematic Universe continua a segnare la storia del cinema
body:
Going News | 18 giugno 2019 | cinema, TV | di Alessandra Bormio | Riproduzione riservata

Avengers: Endgame e Captain Marvel hanno ottenuto riconoscimenti anche nel corso degli MTV Movie & TV Awards 2019

[Disney]


Il Marvel Cinematic Universe ha caratterizzato gli MTV Movie & TV Awards 2019, un risultato conseguito grazie ai popolari Avengers: Endgame e Captain Marvel che rispettivamente hanno racimolato quattro confezioni di popcorn dorate.


Avengers: Endgame ha vinto nella categoria riservata al miglior film, mentre Robert Downey Jr. e Josh Brolin hanno vinto rispettivamente il Best Hero e il Best Villain. Captain Marvel ha ottenuto il Best Fight, per il confronto fisico tra Brie Larson e Minn-Erva di Gemma Chan.


Più riconoscimenti hanno ottenuto anche i film A Star Is Born e Tutte le volte che ho scritto ti amo, distribuito da Netflix. La serie televisiva Il Trono di Spade si è assicurata il titolo di Best Show.


Ecco l'elenco dei premi e dei rispettivi destinatari:

Best Movie
Avengers: Endgame

Best Show
Game of Thrones

Best Performance in a Movie
Lady Gaga (Ally) in A Star Is Born

Best Performance in a Show
Elisabeth Moss (June Osborne/Offred) in The Handmaid’s Tale

Best Hero
Robert Downey Jr. (Tony Stark / Iron Man) in Avengers: Endgame

Best Villain
Josh Brolin (Thanos) in Avengers: Endgame

Best Kiss
Noah Centineo (Peter Kavinsky) & Lana Condor (Lara Jean) in Tutte le volte che ho scritto ti amo

Reality Royalty
Love & Hip Hop: Atlanta

Best Comedic Performance
Dan Levy (David Rose) in Schitt’s Creek

Breakthrough Performance
Noah Centineo (Peter Kavinsky) in Tutte le volte che ho scritto ti amo

Best Fight
Captain Marvel vs. Minn-Erva in Captain Marvel

Best Real-Life Hero
Ruth Bader Ginsburg in RBG

Most Frightened Performance
Sandra Bullock (Malorie) in Bird Box

Best Documentary
Surviving R. Kelly

Best Host
Nick Cannon in Wild ‘n Out

Most Meme-able Moment
Colton Underwood jumps the fence in The Bachelor

Best Musical Moment
Shallow in A Star Is Born

summary: All this talk about Carol being a certified lesbian - hear me out guys - what about her being bisexual? Like, I get what you all...
question: All this talk about Carol being a certified lesbian - hear me out guys - what about her being bisexual? Like, I get what you all see in terms of her basically raising a kid with Maria and all of their chemistry with each other, the way they look at each other, all totally valid points. In the comics though, she was only interested in men - hints of her having a relationship with Wolverine, supposedly having feelings for Spider-Man, dating Rhodes. Tomeshe’s beengiving offwoman-leaningbisexualvibe
answer:
Yeah, super valid and possible that she is bisexual. And as a bisexual person I’d be thrilled to have someone like Carol represent my sexuality. From what we’ve seen in the MCU though I just definitely think she’s giving off some strong lesbian vibes but also she literally has not had a love interest in either movie she’s appeared in so who knows?

I love that they’ve just focused on building Carol’s character first before focusing on her sexuality, and that’s possibly also a way to kind of give the fans little queues that she’s not totally straight to figure out the general reaction before introducing her as a lesbian/bisexual character

From what we’ve seen in the MCU though I just definitely think she’s giving off some strong lesbian vibes but also she literally has not had a love interest in either movie she’s appeared in so who knows?

I love that they’ve just focused on building Carol’s character first before focusing on her sexuality, and that’s possibly also a way to kind of give the fans little queues that she’s not totally straight to figure out the general reaction before introducing her as a lesbian/bisexual character

trail.content_raw:

From what we’ve seen in the MCU though I just definitely think she’s giving off some strong lesbian vibes but also she literally has not had a love interest in either movie she’s appeared in so who knows?

I love that they’ve just focused on building Carol’s character first before focusing on her sexuality, and that’s possibly also a way to kind of give the fans little queues that she’s not totally straight to figure out the general reaction before introducing her as a lesbian/bisexual character

Yeah, super valid and possible that she is bisexual. And as a bisexual person I’d be thrilled to have someone like Carol represent my sexuality. From what we’ve seen in the MCU though I just definitely think she’s giving off some strong lesbian vibes but also she literally has not had a love interest in either movie she’s appeared in so who knows?

I love that they’ve just focused on building Carol’s character first before focusing on her sexuality, and that’s possibly also a way to kind of give the fans little queues that she’s not totally straight to figure out the general reaction before introducing her as a lesbian/bisexual character

summary: Captain Marvel Wins MTV Award, Larson Shares Spotlight with Stunt Doubles
title: Captain Marvel Wins MTV Award, Larson Shares Spotlight with Stunt Doubles
excerpt: At the MTV Awards, Captain Marvel star Brie Larson gave her stunt doubles, Joanna Bennett and Renae Moneymaker the spotlight.
description:
When I see things like this I really don’t understand why so many people seem to dislike Brie Larson. 

I mean what other actor or actress can you name who has had their stunt doubles up on stage with them to accept an award she won together?

Some mention them yeah, but nothing like what Brie did here.

reblog.comment:
When I see things like this I really don’t understand why so many people seem to dislike Brie Larson.

Some mention them yeah, but nothing like what Brie did here.

I'm currently working on a writing project with my boyfriend, Brax, inspired by the world of Tyria in Guild Wars 2. I am also availble for hire. If you need social media management, an editor, a personal assistant, or just some writing help, contact me at herogirlpenforhire@gmail.com. You can also access my Tip Jar here: https://paypal.me/herogirl

summary: 'Avengers,' But Make It Without Women, Or Men Hugging, Or Levity In General
body:
‘Avengers,’ But Make It Without Women, Or Men Hugging, Or Levity In General

When we say “men are trash,” this is what we mean.

“This particular defeminized edit is just the latest example of a trend, says Suzanne Scott, a professor of film and media studies at the University of Texas. A similar "chauvinist cut” of 2017’s Star Wars: The Last Jedi removed key scenes of women making decisions, giving orders, having ideas and fighting in battle. So much was trimmed, Scott says, that only about 30% of the original film remained.“

summary: Batman and Superman Set To Meet The (Billy) Batson Who Laughs
title: Batman and Superman Set To Meet The (Billy) Batson Who Laughs
body:
Bruce Wayne Meets (Billy) Batson Who Laughs

Article by Sam McTernan

Batman and Superman are set to meet the (Billy) Batson who laughs in the upcoming Batman/Superman #1.

Thanks to a preview from DC Comics we know the interaction will happen in the new monthly series. Following directly on from the events of The Batman Who Laughs, the Man Of Steel and our very own Caped Crusader are in for a rough ride.

The official synopsis sets up what I…

summary: Brie stans are constantly begging her to post more online. I wouldn't blame her for throwing her phone away. She did an amazing...
body:
Brie stans are constantly begging her to post more online. I wouldn’t blame her for throwing her phone away. She did an amazing thing bringing her stunt doubles on stage and people are still vile.

I hope she sees how much people love her and finds a way to block the hate, though we all know how hard that is.
